infotexts.entitydescription.defibrillator: A medical device delivering an electric shock to the heart to stabilize cardiac arythmias. Requires extensive medical training. Use on a patient with cardiac arrest.
infotexts.entitydescription.aed: A medical device delivering an electric shock to the heart to stabilize cardiac arythmias. Requires little to no medical training. Use on a patient with cardiac arrest.
infotexts.entitydescription.bvm: A bag valve mask (BVM), is a hand-held device commonly used to provide positive pressure ventilation to patients who are not breathing or not breathing adequately.
infotexts.entitydescription.autocpr: An automated, portable, battery-powered cardiopulmonary resuscitation device.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodanalyzer: Blood analyzer. Fully automated. Can print bloodtypes on blank donor cards.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodcollector: Empty donor card. Used by the hematology analyzer.
infotexts.entitydescription.traumashears: A tool used to remove bandages and casts.
infotexts.entitydescription.wheelchair: Makes you depend on your arms instead of your legs for movement.

Override.entitydescription.healthscanner: Used to diagnose underlying causes of symptoms.

infotexts.stasisbagequipconfirmation: Equipping this will cause you to go unconscious. Are you sure?
infotexts.entitydescription.advscalpel: A tool used to make incisions during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.advhemostat: A tool used to clamp blood vessels during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.advretractors: A tool used to retract skin during surgery.
infotexts.entitydescription.tweezers: A small tool that allows the removal of bullets as well as damaged and necrotic tissue.
infotexts.entitydescription.surgerysaw: A tool used to saw through bones.
infotexts.entitydescription.suture: Biodegradeable sutures for stitching up wounds and surgical incisions alike.
infotexts.entitydescription.surgicaldrill: A tool used to drill bones.
infotexts.entitydescription.osteosynthesisimplants: Titanium implants used in an osteosynthetic surgery to repair fractures.
infotexts.entitydescription.spinalimplant: Titanium implants used to heal paralysis caused by neck fractures.
infotexts.entitydescription.operatingtable: A surgery table which has basic artificial ventilation built in.
infotexts.entitydescription.organscalpel_liver: A specialized scalpel for the removal of livers.
infotexts.entitydescription.organscalpel_kidneys: A specialized scalpel for the removal of kidneys.
infotexts.entitydescription.organscalpel_lungs: A specialized scalpel for the removal of the lungs.
infotexts.entitydescription.organscalpel_heart: A specialized scalpel for the removal of the heart.
infotexts.entitydescription.organscalpel_brain: A specialized scalpel for the removal of the brain.
infotexts.entitydescription.multiscalpel: Novelty scalpel. Disabled and needs activation. In the practitioner’s hands, a button pad can be utilised to activate the scalpel and switch between between operations: making incisions, extracting organs, removing bandages, or doing malpractice.
infotexts.multiscalpel.bandage: Mode active: Remove bandages and casts / malpractice
infotexts.multiscalpel.speedflex: Mode active: Adaptive organ extraction. Use on head for brain, left arm for kidneys, torso for liver, right arm for heart, left leg for lungs.
infotexts.entitydescription.mannitol: A type of sugar alcohol. It is used to aid recovery from neurotrauma. May cause organ damage.
infotexts.entitydescription.streptokinase: A thrombolytic enzyme that breaks down blood clots. It is used to cure heart attacks. Decreases blood clotting.
infotexts.entitydescription.immunosuppressant: An immunosuppressive agent for the prevention of organ rejection.
infotexts.entitydescription.thiamine: Otherwise known as vitamin B1, these pills will aid in organ healing.
infotexts.entitydescription.pressuremeds: A medication used to lower blood pressure.
infotexts.entitydescription.ointment: A highly antiseptic gel that promotes the recovery from burns as well as from minor infections.
infotexts.entitydescription.endovascballoon: A balloon inserted into major arteries following their rupture. It will cut off bloodflow, but it will stop the bleeding.
infotexts.entitydescription.medstent: A plastic tube inserted into the aorta after an endovascular ballon following aortic rupture.
infotexts.entitydescription.tourniquet: A device that applies pressure to a limb and thus reduces bloodflow. It is usually used in case of major bleeders on extremities. Shouldn't be used on the head.
infotexts.entitydescription.drainage: Drains air from the pleural cavity during corrective surgery for pneumothorax.
infotexts.entitydescription.needle: A needle with a decompression valve to make the air or liquid drain out of the pleural cavity or pericardium
infotexts.entitydescription.ringerssolution: A solution of several salts dissolved in water for the purpose of treating low blood pressure or fluid loss. Isotonic to blood.
infotexts.entitydescription.antiseptic: Can be used to treat infected wounds using an antiseptic spray.
infotexts.entitydescription.antisepticspray: Used to apply antiseptic to infected wounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.propofol: A short-acting medication that results in a decreased level of consciousness and a lack of memory for events. Its uses include the starting and maintenance of general anesthesia.
infotexts.entitydescription.gypsum: A fine mineral powder that is used to encase fractures in extremeties in a cast. Apply a bandage first.
infotexts.entitydescription.gelipack: A reusable cooling pack filled with organic gel that never expires. Loses its effectiveness without refrigeration.
infotexts.entitydescription.emptybloodpack: An empty blood pack for the drawing of blood.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodpackoplus: Administerable to: O+, A+, B+, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodpackominus: A blood pack that can be used on any patient.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodpackaminus: Administerable to: A-, A+, AB-, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodpackbminus: Administerable to: B-, B+, AB-, AB+

Override.entitydescription.antibloodloss2: A blood pack that can be used on any patient.

infotexts.entitydescription.ominuscard: Can take blood from: O- Can give blood to: all of them
infotexts.entitydescription.opluscard: Can take blood from: O-, O+ Can give blood to: O+, A+, B+, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.aminuscard: Can take blood from: O-, A- Can give blood to: A-, A+, AB-, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.apluscard: Can take blood from: O-, O+, A-, A+ Can give blood to: A+, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.bminuscard: Can take blood from: O-, B- Can give blood to: B-, B+, AB-, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.bpluscard: Can take blood from: O-, O+, B-, B+ Can give blood to: B+, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.abminuscard: Can take blood from: O-, A-, B-, AB- Can give blood to: AB-, AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.abpluscard: Can take blood from: all of them Can give blood to: AB+
infotexts.entitydescription.medtoolbox: Can store medicine and medical instruments
infotexts.entitydescription.surgerytoolbox: Can store many small items that are used during surgery
infotexts.entitydescription.organcrate: A place to store your precious transplant-ready organs
infotexts.entitydescription.medstartercrate: A crate that contains all the essentials, conveniently packaged into a single crafting recipe
infotexts.entitydescription.organtoolbox: A place to store your precious transplant-ready organs
infotexts.entitydescription.stasisbag: Stops most biological processes from taking place.
infotexts.entitydescription.rarm: A severed right arm. Can be surgically reattached.
infotexts.entitydescription.larm: A severed left arm. Can be surgically reattached.
infotexts.entitydescription.rleg: A severed right leg. Can be surgically reattached.
infotexts.entitydescription.lleg: A severed left leg. Can be surgically reattached.
infotexts.entitydescription.heada: A severed head, or what's left of it.
infotexts.entitydescription.rarmp: A bionic right arm. Can be used to treat amputation.
infotexts.entitydescription.larmp: A bionic left arm. Can be used to treat amputation.
infotexts.entitydescription.rlegp: A bionic right leg. Can be used to treat amputation.
infotexts.entitydescription.llegp: A bionic left leg. Can be used to treat amputation.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tachycardia: The heart is beating in an alarmingly rapid fashion.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.fibrillation: The heart is beating in a fluttery, quivering fashion.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.heartremoved: The heart has been surgically removed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.brainremoved: The brain has been surgically removed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.traumaticshock: You shouldn't be getting dug into like this! This is very wrong!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hyperventilation: The patient is breathing at an alarmingly rapid rate.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hypoventilation: The patient is breathing at an alarmingly slow rate.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dyspnea: The patients breathing is labored and shallow.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.lungremoved: The lungs have been surgically removed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.kidneyremoved: The kidneys have been surgically removed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bonegrowth: Bone regrowth has been stimulated. To cure bone death, this affliction needs to be on every bodypart.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.liverremoved: The liver has been surgically removed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.surgeryincision: An incision has been made by a scalpel.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.arteriesclamp: Bleeding from artery has been stopped, but blood flow to the extremity is severely reduced.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.balloonedaorta: The aorta has stopped bleeding, but bloodflow to your extremities and organs is gone.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bandaged: Protects from infection, stabilizes dislocations. Movement is slightly slowed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dirtybandage: Used to protect from infections, but now it does the opposite.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.gypsumcast: Heals and protects from fractures. Movement is slowed. Remove using trauma shears.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.ointmented: A layer of antibiotic gel protects and cleans the wound from any germs.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.needlec: Normalizes the pressure in the pleural cavity
infotexts.afflictiondescription.t_fracture: One or more of your ribs are broken.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tra_amputation: Most of the tissue of the right arm was torn off.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tla_amputation: Most of the tissue of the left arm was torn off.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.trl_amputation: Most of the tissue of the right leg was torn off.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tll_amputation: Most of the tissue of the left leg was torn off.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.th_amputation: Most of the tissue of the head was torn off.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sra_amputation: The right arm was surgically amputated.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sla_amputation: The left arm was surgically amputated.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.srl_amputation: The right leg was surgically amputated.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sll_amputation: The left leg was surgically amputated.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.t_paralysis: The patient is paralyzed and does not feel the body.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dislocation1: The joint isn't supposed to bend this way...
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dislocation2: The joint isn't supposed to bend this way...
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dislocation3: The joint isn't supposed to bend this way...
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dislocation4: The joint isn't supposed to bend this way...
infotexts.afflictiondescription.ll_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe bloodloss.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.rl_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe bloodloss.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.la_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe bloodloss.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.ra_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe bloodloss.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.h_arterialcut: An artery has been damaged and is causing severe bloodloss.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.gangrene: The extremity has shrunk and turned black.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_blurredvision: The patient is expressing blurred vision.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_confusion: The patient seems disoriented and confused.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_headache: The patient is expressing a headache.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_weakness: The patient is expressing weakness in the extremities.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_wheezing: The patients breathing is producing a high-pitched noise.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_hematemesis: The patient is vomiting blood periodically.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.fever: The patients body temperature is elevated.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_abdomdiscomfor: The patient is expressing abdominal discomfort.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_jaundice: The patients skin has turned a sickly shade of yellow.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.inflammation: The area is red, swollen and warm.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.spasm: The patient can't control the erratic behaviour of the limb.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_craving: The patient is happy enough... so long as they get what they need.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.onfire: The patient is burning alive! Grab an extinguisher!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pain_chest: The patient is expressing sharp, piercing pain in their chest.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pain_abdominal: The patient is expressing persistent pain in their abdomen.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pain_extremity: The patient is expressing intense pain in the affected area.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sym_nausea: The skin is clammy and the patient is nauseous.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.luabotomy: Lua isn't running. That means neurotrauma and any other mods that use it won't work. Please read the workshop pages of mods you plan to use.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.modconflict: There is a mod conflict. A different mod is overriding some of the same items Neurotrauma does. Some things may not function correctly. Please adjust your load order.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.anesthesia: The patient has drug-induced amnesia and sedation.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn_deg1: The area is red and painful to the touch.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn_deg2: There are very painful blisters littering the affected area.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn_deg3: The patient doesn't feel pain in the now leathery, stiff area.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.surgeryincision: The patient has been cut open.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.clampedbleeders: Bleeding caused by the incision has been stopped.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.retractedskin: The skin is being held open by a set of retractors.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drilledbones: The bones have been prepared for orthopedic procedures.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.suturedi: An incision has been closed via sutures.
infotexts.loadingscreentip: ‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Non-medical personnel can treat cardiac arrest with the use of adrenaline or an AutoPulse.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ On fire? You may be closer to a diving suit than the ballast or fire extinguisher.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ If you cannot safely treat a dislocation, a bandage will restore the limb's function.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Analgesia isn't limited to surgical use. Painlessness increases damage and stun resistance.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ The AED will always reset fibrillation regardless of medical training.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Drugs can still be administered to a patient in a Stasis Bag.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Liquid oxygenite prevents unconsciousness caused by hypoxemia.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Remember to pick up your limb after it is traumatically amputated.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Kidney and liver damage will cause neurotrauma.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ For a full range of diagnosis, remember to check the Health UI, health scanner, and hematology analyzer.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Multiple symptoms are exclusive to hemotransfusion shock.

‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ If you have taken too much damage on one limb, it may no longer naturally regenerate. Bandages and ice packs speed up natural regeneration, instead of treating wounds.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ You can administer an AutoPulse in the Health UI to immediately equip it on the individual. Wrench on torso will unequip it.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Keep an eye on your visual effects. An early diagnosis can be made based on the situation.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Neck fractures can cause spinal cord injury before becoming visible in the Health UI.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ The AutoPulse is always better than CPR, and their effects do not stack.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Hypoxemia refers to insufficient oxygen in the blood. Not to be confused with hypoxia, also known as oxygen low (insufficient oxygen in the lungs).

‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Mannitol only treats neurotrauma if blood pressure is greater than 70% and hypoxemia is less than 30%. If conditions aren't met, it will slow down the progression of neurotrauma.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Bots will not alert you of their health status. Check on them often.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ You can use a tweezer through open gunshot or deep tissue wounds, but this will always cause minor traumatic shock.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Fibrillation is always dangerous. Blood pressure drops much faster than it rises.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Concussions are never dangerous, but cause multiple symptoms which may be confused with dangerous afflictions.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ The human body will always reject alien blood, regardless of immunity strength.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Immunity strength affects natural healing of infected wounds, organ rejection, and incompatible blood type rejection.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ If you are using the Trello guide, make sure you are using the version for the Community Fork.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Internal wounds such as blunt force trauma have no risk of infection.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Sepsis can only be treated with broad-spectrum antibiotics. Make sure to keep some around.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Any bed other than a surgical or hospital one only prevent traumatic shock if the patient is laying on them.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ You can collect one blood pack at a time from healthy humans, assuming the application is successful.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ To treat gangrene past 15%, you must attach a limb if none exists, stitch, remove it, stitch, attach a new limb, stitch.

‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Most affliction chances and gain rates can be configured. To find the config, open the Esc menu after loading into a game. Screams, gypsum cast behavior, and organ rejection may also be configured.

‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ It is possible, but mentally demanding, to play without a health scanner or hematology analyzer. Most afflictions can be diagnosed with context, symptoms, and visual effects.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Dislocations are extremely common after being caught in an explosion.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ The chance of gaining most afflictions, such as fractures and cardiac tamponade, depends on damage taken. If you take less damage, you will require less treatment.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Low on gypsum? Limbs can be deconstructed into calcium.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Chemical and opiate withdrawal are never lethal, but severe alcohol withdrawal can be.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Heart and lung damage are non-lethal until they reach 100%.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Keep a blue shark around. You never know when you might need one.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Some symptoms override each other. You can't hear palpitations if your heart isn't beating.
‖color:gui.blue‖Neurotrauma:‖end‖ Neurotrauma is synonymous with brain damage. 200% neurotrauma means brain death.
